badge_template_activities.title: Leaders participate in 6 personal leadership modules focused on the following topics; Starting with Why, Trust and Influence, Telling and Selling Your Value, Ensuring Sponsorship, Strategic Networking, and Authentic Leadership.
Participants engage in a “pays it forward” capstone project for future women leaders at Guardian.
Leaders engage in peer learning groups that discuss the topics, share best practices, and network with each other.
Six months of professional coaching through a partnership with Ezra is provided to all leaders.

7d69f039-6975-4caf-b210-7986b3d90cb5.description: The Emerging Leader Development Program (ELDP) is a 7-month, rigorous nomination-based program that develops our next generation of leaders. ELDP provides an enterprise-wide pipeline for talented, strategic, and diverse talent to make new connections, turn insights into customer impact, and surface new ideas. Our leaders strengthen their leadership capabilities through workshops, coaching, executive interviews, networking, action challenges, and a final capstone presentation.
7d69f039-6975-4caf-b210-7986b3d90cb5.name: Emerging Leader Development Program

issuer.summary: issued by The Guardian Life Insurance Company of America

entity.name: The Guardian Life Insurance Company of America

badge_template_activities.title: Complete 360 and DiSC assessments
Six months of professional coaching through a partnership with Ezra is provided to all leaders.

Participants engage in a capstone project and design a solution to a company action challenge. Leaders are intentionally assigned projects with cross-functional teams to build business acumen. Leaders participate in the "Shark Tank" capstone event which includes: rehearsing and networking with other participants, exposure to senior leaders, an award and recognition ceremony and celebration, and finally, the winning team(s) project is funded and brought to fruition.

Leaders participate in 10+ Workshops (equating to over 40+hours), such as; Innovation with Amazon, Design Thinking, Grow More with Mentoring, Portfolio Intake Process, Discovering you DiSC Style, JEDI (Justice, Equity, Diversity & Inclusion) + Leadership, Data for Leaders with General Assembly, How We Make Money? How We Manage Risk?, Ethics & Leadership, Developing your Speaking Style with Speakeasy
All participants receive a personalized award to recognize all their hard work and dedication.

057a4dd4-cb2a-4a94-b580-7bf591012430.description: The Early Career Program is a comprehensive blended learning experience that prepares emerging talent for roles in our Distribution Organization. Group Benefit sales trainees who are awarded this badge have successfully fulfilled all requirements of the Early Career Program and are ready to move into production in their designated market.
057a4dd4-cb2a-4a94-b580-7bf591012430.name: Group Benefits - Sales Early Career Program

issuer.summary: issued by The Guardian Life Insurance Company of America

entity.name: The Guardian Life Insurance Company of America

badge_template_activities.title: Participants are required to complete a comprehensive learning program that includes passing a final capstone project. The program consists of an online learning curriculum, weekly cohort calls, live and virtual training academies as well as hands on field learning activities which include shadowing and role rotations. Each participant is assigned a mentor to help with the transition of knowledge into real world application.

Throughout the program participants are required to learn about Guardian products, processes, and systems. They also learn selling skills and soft skills such as time management and relationship building skills. Participants must also embrace and live our company values to bring Guardian’s purpose of inspiring well-being for our colleagues, customers, and communities to life.

f0daf5c4-053a-4ab8-9325-187f88e314bb.description: The “Power of Information” Case Review Specialist training program is a 2-month learning, demonstration, and performance coaching experience with a defined certification process. Group Benefit sales professionals who are awarded this badge have successfully completed two levels of training (Fundamentals & Advanced) in case review, analysis and quoting strategies to offer timely, accurate and competitive quotes to brokers and companies out-to-market with group benefits providers.
f0daf5c4-053a-4ab8-9325-187f88e314bb.name: Group Benefits - Case Review Specialist Certification

issuer.summary: issued by The Guardian Life Insurance Company of America

entity.name: The Guardian Life Insurance Company of America

badge_template_activities.title: Participants are required to complete 35 hours of comprehensive training and pass a post-training knowledge assessment.
As part of a learning cohort, all participants complete self-directed training modules, and attend a series of live/facilitated best practice “deep dive” sessions.

Throughout the 2-month training program, participants are required to demonstrate acquired skills through application activities including case studies and real case reviews accompanied by performance assessments and coaching.
